intro: Erucastrum laevigatum subsp. elatum, commonly known as the tall bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent odor. The plant features a slender, erect stem with alternate leaves that are usually hairy and lobed. Its fruit is a slender, elongated pod that contains several small, round seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
